intro: Belonophora ongensis, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Belonophora ongensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive flowers and adaptability to various growing conditions.
